newsitem.title: CANADA: Suncor, Enron in gas marketing deal.
newsitem.headline: Suncor, Enron in gas marketing deal.

text.p: Suncor Inc said on Wednesday that it and Enron Capital & Trade Resources Canada Corp, a unit of Enron Corp, intended to form an alliance in which Enron would handle the operational aspects of Suncor's natural gas marketing.
Under the arrangement, Enron would handle such gas marketing details as nominations and account balancing, allowing Suncor to concentrate on "more strategic elements," Suncor said.
Suncor said the initial focus of the deal would be to boost the value of its gas portfolio.

"One of the distinctive features of this relationship is the segregation of the operational from the strategic aspects of our business," said Barry Stewart, Suncor's executive vice-president of exploration and production.
"We will keep our links with customers and manage our portfolio, but we expect that working with a world energy leader like ECT will give us a new perspective on the business."

Besides the operational aspects of gas marketing, Enron will work with Suncor to increase the value of its gas business using such alternatives as repositioning pipeline commitments, reducing energy consumption costs and reviewing strategies for marketing natural gas liquids, the company said.
The companies said nothing in their alliance would stop either from pursuing business opportunities with other industry players.
